org.strongback.command

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strongback.command.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommandGroup, ControllerCommand

    public abstract class Command
extends Object
    The abstract base class for the Strongback command framework.
    See Also:
    Requirable, Strongback.submit(Command)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Command

        protected Command(double timeoutInSeconds,
                  Requirable... requirements)
        Create a new command with the given timeout and zero or more Requirable components
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds - how long in seconds this command executes before terminating, zero is forever
        requirements - the Requirables this Command requires

      • Command

        protected Command(long timeoutInNanoseconds,
                  Collection<Requirable> requirements)
        Create a new command with the given timeout and zero or more Requirable components
        Parameters:
        timeoutInNanoseconds - how long in nanoseconds this command executes before terminating, zero is forever
        requirements - the Requirables this Command requires

      • Command

        protected Command(double timeoutInSeconds,
                  Collection<Requirable> requirements)
        Create a new command with the given timeout and zero or more Requirable components
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds - how long in seconds this command executes before terminating, zero is forever
        requirements - the Requirables this Command requires

      • Command

        protected Command(Requirable... requirements)
        Create a new command with no timeout and zero or more Requirable components
        Parameters:
        requirements - the Requirables this Command requires

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Perform a one-time setup of this Command prior to any calls to execute(). No physical hardware should be manipulated.

        By default this method does nothing.

      • execute

        public abstract boolean execute()
        Perform the primary logic of this command. This method will be called repeatedly after this Command is initialized until it returns true.
        Returns:
        true if this Command is complete; false otherwise

      • interrupted

        public void interrupted()
        Signal that this command has been interrupted before initialization or execution could successfully complete. A command is interrupted when the command is canceled, when the robot is shutdown while the command is still running, or when initialize() or execute() throw exceptions. Note that if this method is called, then end() will not be called on the command.

        By default this method does nothing.

      • end

        public void end()
        Perform one-time clean up of the resources used by this command and typically putting the robot in a safe state. This method is always called after execute() returns true unless interrupted() is called.

        By default this method does nothing.

      • setNotInterruptible

        protected final void setNotInterruptible()
        Sets this Command to not be interrupted if another command with the same requirements is added to the scheduler.

        By default the new command will cancel the old one; call this method if the new command will not interrupt the old one.

      • use

        public static Command use(Controller controller,
                          Runnable initializer)
        Create a command that uses the unmanaged Controller to move toward the specified target using controller's tolerance. The controller is not automatically and continuously measuring the input and computing and applying the correct output, and only does so when this command is executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller; may not be null
        initializer - the function that runs when the command is started and configures the controller's target, tolerance, and any other controller settings
        Returns:
        the command; never null

      • use

        public static Command use(Controller controller,
                          double setpoint)
        Create a command that uses the unmanaged Controller to move toward the specified target using controller's tolerance. The controller is not automatically and continuously measuring the input and computing and applying the correct output, and only does so when this command is executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller; may not be null
        setpoint - the desired value for the input to the controller
        Returns:
        the command; never null

      • use

        public static Command use(Controller controller,
                          double setpoint,
                          double tolerance)
        Create a command that uses the unmanaged Controller to move with the specified tolerance of the given target. The controller is not automatically and continuously measuring the input and computing and applying the correct output, and only does so when this command is executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller; may not be null
        setpoint - the desired value for the input to the controller
        tolerance - the absolute tolerance for how close the controller should come before completing the command
        Returns:
        the command; never null

      • use

        public static Command use(double durationInSeconds,
                          Controller controller,
                          double setpoint)
        Create a command that uses the unmanaged Controller to move toward the controller's target using the current tolerance, timing out if the command takes longer than durationInSeconds. The controller is not automatically and continuously measuring the input and computing and applying the correct output, and only does so when this command is executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:
        durationInSeconds - the maximum duration in seconds that the command should execute; must be non-negative, and 0.0 equates to forever
        controller - the controller; may not be null
        setpoint - the desired value for the input to the controller
        Returns:
        the command; never null

      • use

        public static Command use(double durationInSeconds,
                          Controller controller,
                          double setpoint,
                          double tolerance)
        Create a command that uses the unmanaged Controller to move toward the controller's target, timing out if the command takes longer than durationInSeconds. The controller is not automatically and continuously measuring the input and computing and applying the correct output, and only does so when this command is executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:
        durationInSeconds - the maximum duration in seconds that the command should execute; must be non-negative, and 0.0 equates to forever
        controller - the controller; may not be null
        setpoint - the desired value for the input to the controller
        tolerance - the absolute tolerance for how close the controller should come before completing the command
        Returns:
        the command; never null

      • use

        public static Command use(double durationInSeconds,
                          Controller controller,
                          Runnable initializer)
        Create a command that uses the unmanaged Controller to move toward the specified target using controller's tolerance, timing out if the command takes longer than durationInSeconds. The controller is not automatically and continuously measuring the input and computing and applying the correct output, and only does so when this command is executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the command; never null

      • reuse

        public static Command reuse(Controller controller,
                            Runnable initializer)
        Create a command that reuses the automatically running Controller to move toward the specified target using controller's tolerance. The controller automatically and continuously measures the input and computing and applies the correct output, even when this command is not executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller; may not be null
        initializer - the function that runs when the command is started and configures the controller's target, tolerance, and any other controller settings
        Returns:
        the command; never null

      • reuse

        public static Command reuse(Controller controller,
                            double setpoint)
        Create a command that reuses the automatically running Controller to move toward the specified target using controller's tolerance. The controller automatically and continuously measures the input and computing and applies the correct output, even when this command is not executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller; may not be null
        setpoint - the desired value for the input to the controller
        Returns:
        the command; never null

        Parameters:

        the command; never null

The controller automatically and continuously measures the input and computing and applies the correct output, even when this command is not executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.

        public static Command reuse(double durationInSeconds,
                            Controller controller,
                            Runnable initializer)
        Create a command that uses the automatically running Controller to move toward the specified target using controller's tolerance, timing out if the command takes longer than durationInSeconds. The controller automatically and continuously measures the input and computing and applies the correct output, even when this command is not executing. The given initializer will be called when the command is initialized and should be used to update the controller's target, tolerance, and other controller settings.

        the command; never null

      • cancel

        public static Command cancel(Requirable... requirables)
        Create a new command object that will cancel all currently-running commands that require the supplied Requirable objects. When this command is submitted, it will preempt any running (or scheduled) command that also requires any of the supplied Requirables.
        Parameters:
        requirables - the Requirables for which any currently-running commands should be cancelled.
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • pause

        public static Command pause(long pauseTime,
                            TimeUnit unit)
        Create a new command object that does nothing but pause for the specified time. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        pauseTime - the time
        unit - the time unit
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • pause

        public static Command pause(double pauseTimeInSeconds)
        Create a new command object that does nothing but pause for the specified time. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        pauseTimeInSeconds - the time in seconds
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        public static Command create(Runnable executeFunction)
        Create a new command that runs once by executing the supplied function. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        public static Command create(double durationInSeconds,
                             Runnable executeFunction)
        Create a new command that runs once by executing the supplied function. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        durationInSeconds - the maximum duration in seconds that the command should execute; must be positive
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        public static Command create(double durationInSeconds,
                             Runnable executeFunction,
                             Runnable endFunction)
        Create a new command that runs once by executing the supplied function, then wait the prescribed amount of time, and then call the supplied endFunction. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        durationInSeconds - the maximum duration in seconds that the command should execute; must be positive
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        endFunction - the function to be called when the command terminates; may be null
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        public static Command create(BooleanSupplier executeFunction)
        Create a new command that runs one or more times by executing the supplied function. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        public static Command create(BooleanSupplier executeFunction,
                             Runnable endFunction)
        Create a new command that runs one or more times by executing the supplied function. When the command terminates, the endFunction will be called. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        endFunction - the function to be called when the command terminates; may be null
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        public static Command create(double timeoutInSeconds,
                             BooleanSupplier executeFunction)
        Create a new command that runs one or more times by executing the supplied function, but that will timeout if taking longer than the specified timeout. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds - the time in seconds
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        public static Command create(double timeoutInSeconds,
                             BooleanSupplier executeFunction,
                             Runnable endFunction)
        Create a new command that runs one or more times by executing the supplied function, but that will timeout if taking longer than the specified timeout. When the command terminates, the endFunction will be called. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds - the time in seconds
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        endFunction - the function to be called when the command terminates; may be null
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        protected static Command create(double timeoutInSeconds,
                                BooleanSupplier executeFunction,
                                Supplier<String> toString,
                                Requirable... requirements)
        Create a new command that runs one or more times by executing the supplied function, but that will timeout if taking longer than the specified timeout. When the command terminates, the endFunction will be called. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds - the time in seconds
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        toString - the function to be called when Object.toString() is called; may not be null
        requirements - the Requirables for the command
        Returns:
        the new command; never null

      • create

        protected static Command create(double timeoutInSeconds,
                                BooleanSupplier executeFunction,
                                Runnable endFunction,
                                Supplier<String> toString,
                                Requirable... requirements)
        Create a new command that runs one or more times by executing the supplied function, but that will timeout if taking longer than the specified timeout. When the command terminates, the endFunction will be called. The resulting command will have no Requirables.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInSeconds - the time in seconds
        executeFunction - the function to be called during execution; may not be null
        endFunction - the function to be called when the command terminates; may be null
        toString - the function to be called when Object.toString() is called; may not be null
        requirements - the Requirables for the command
        Returns:
        the new command; never null
